text:
If a HubSpot customer uses volume, stairstep, or tiered pricing, what is the best practice to represent these prices in a quote/opportunity? e.g.
*Volume* (all units rated at highest tier reached)*:*
• Tier 1: 0-9,999 units: $0.10
• Tier 2: 10,000-19,999 units: $0.09
• Tier 3: 20,000 - unlimited: $0.08
Maybe customer A uses these rack rates, but Customer B negotiates a Tier 3 rate of $0.07.

It looks like I should create a product per tier where each would have it's own SKU?
• Product: Volume Tier 1
• Product: Volume Tier 2
• Product: Volume Tier 3

Hello all,
can someone help me with a task
We need to get our site set up with Apple Pay, and there's a quick task I need your help with.
I Have to create a .well-known folder inside root directory of our website which is hosted in HubSpot (where the index.html file is).
Upload one file named pple-developer-merchantid-domain-association into the .well-known folder.
The final path should be:
<https://orbixplay.com/.well-known/apple-developer-merchantid-domain-association>

for now I can not find the root directory in HubSpot and create that file
Hi Karandeep. Can you give a little bit more info on what you're trying to do? Are you trying to pass an `authorization` header in calls to localhost? Any more info you could give would be helpful.
